citation.article-title: Promicromonospora sukumoe sp. nov., a new species of the Actinomycetales
citation.source: The Journal of General and Applied Microbiology

p.s: Description of Promicromonospora sukumoe sp. nov.
Promicromonospora sukumoe (su. ku. mo. e M. L. ferm. adj. sukumoe Sukumo City, Kochi Prefecture in Japan, where the soil sample was collected from which strain SK-2049 was isolated)
P. sukumoe grows well on synthetic and organic agar media under aerobic condition.
The substrate mycelia fragment into bacillary and coccoid elements.
Poor aerial mycelia without spores are produced on a few agar media.
In general, the colonies are yellow in color; leathery on synthetic media, but bacteroid on organic ones.
No growth occurs under anaerobic conditions.
The cell wall contains lysine and belongs to type VI.
The characteristic whole cell sugars are glucose, ribose and rhamnose.
The phospholipid is PI or P IV type.
The N-acylmuramic acid in the cell wall is an acetyl type.
Soluble pigments and melanins are not produced.
The range of growth temperature is 10 to 35°C.
The type strain of P. sukumoe is strain SK-2049 (= JCM 6845 = IFO 14650).
